name: Fish Tacos
description: Crispy panko-crusted fish tacos with hoisin mayo sauce.

Fish: 1 lb tilapia fillets, cut into strips

ingredients: 1 lb tilapia fillets, cut into strips
instructions: In a bowl, whisk mayo with hoisin sauce, pickle relish and lemon juice. Set aside.
In a large resealable plastic bag, combine flour, garlic powder, onion powder, salt and white pepper. Seal bag and shake. Add fish and shake to coat.
Put eggs and panko in separate shallow bowls. Dip fish in egg and then in panko. Transfer fish to a wax paper-lined platter.

In a large, deep skillet, heat oil to 350Â°F. Add half the fish and fry over moderate heat, turning once, until golden, about 3 minutes. Drain fish on paper towel-lined platter. Repeat with remaining fish.
Serve fish in tortillas, passing hoisin mayo, cabbage, lettuce, cilantro and scallions for topping.
notes: Cocktail pairing suggestion: Margarita made with Patron Silver.
